info.title: WIEDPUG API
info.description: API Documentation for the WIEDPUG Network

post.summary: Transmit new Auction Catalogues and Private Catalogues
post.description: Transmit Original broadcast and private auction catalogue data to the Network for auctions regulated by the Australian Wool Exchange Limited.

post.summary: Request for Data relating to Auction Catalogue, Private Catalogue and Auction Catalogue Updates
post.description: Used by brokers to request Private and Broadcast data, as well as Re-requesting data for Auction Catalogues, Private Catalogues, and Auction Catalogue Updates

apiMessages.message:
Resason:  You have requested data but there is nothing available.
Action: If you have requested private data, wait until more data is received by the network and try again.  If your data should be there, check with the Network Administrator. If you have requested broadcast data, either this is not yet available, or you have incorrectly specified the sale number, broker etc. in the RequestForData. Check this and try again later.

versionNumber.description:
The version number of the WIEDPUG Handbook that the transmission relates to
Two digits. e.g. 99

LiteralDate.description:
Date value in ISO standard UTC date format. e.g. 2024-03-21 (YYYY-MM-DD).

dateOfCreditNote: Date the Credit note was issued

dateOfOriginalInvoice: Date of the original invoice\ndateIssue: The date the certificate was issued.

dateLastUpdated: The day the item was last amended.

statementDate: The period ending date of the statement.

statementPaymentDate: The date the payment was made.

datePaymentMade: Required date field for the date payment was made.

saleDate: The date on which the wool was sold.

coreTestSamplingDate: For Fibre Diameter Histogram Header and Test Request Verification this is the date core test was sampled or date combination/OML was requested. For the Lot Header this is the date the core test was sampled, the last date of weighing for untested wool or the date the Combination/OML was requested.

itemDate: The date the cost of the item was incurred.

CountryCode.description:
A code for the country in which the transmission was created. Country Code using ISO 3166-1 standard
AU: Australia
NZ: New Zealand
DE: Germany
IT: Italy
CN: China
TW: Taiwan

Organisation.description:
A code used to identify organisations involved in the wool trade.

These codes are issued and maintained by the Network and are available online.

currentReceiver: The code for the organisation that will receive the document at the end of the current transmission.Where a document is transferred from one
organisation to another through an intermediary, the code for the current receiver will vary from leg to leg of the journey.

releasingOrganisation: The broker that is responsible for releasing the wool out of the store.

markingOrganisation: The code for the organisation which is to apply marks to the bales.

invoicingOrganisation: The code for the broker who will raise the invoice for the wool.

storageOrganisation: This is the organisation store that is storing the wool. Note: If there is more than one organisation in a centre, then separate AWEX codes are 
required for each store. It is not necessarily the same as the Releasing Organisation.

client: The code for the organisation that is the transmitters client. Where one organisation submits a TRV document to a Test House requesting tests 
for one of its own clients, the code for that client will be used in this field.

Centre.description:
Centre has country and centreCode.

The centreCode is one of these below based on the value of country.

The mapping of country:centreCode is the following:
            
AU:CentreCodeAustralia

NZ: CentreNewZealand

DE: CentreGermany

IT: CentreItaly

CN: CentreChina

TW: CentreTaiwan

The legacy codes for Overseas Centre are under CentreCodeAustralia

centreStorage: The centre (code) representing the location at which the wool is stored (relevant to the intended use of the document). For example, the
Centre- Storage against a lot in the Catalogue is the location of the wool where the buyer would expect to take delivery.

centreCatalogue: The centre (code) used to group lots of wool based on a location. This location is typically the core test/weighing centre and is often aligned with the sellers Post Sale Charge schedule.

centreDelivery: Inclusion of the Delivery Area Centre Code is Mandatory when the Post Sale Service Charge includes delivery to a nominated area and a D is included in the Delivery Basis Field.

centreAlternateDelivery: This field is to be used when the PSC includes optional delivery to a second area.

SoftwareCompany.description:
1: Talman
2: Symbotic
3: Jumbuck/Datacon
4: Jemalong
5: NA - no value
6: Modiano
7: AWH
8: AWTA

CatalogueType.description:
Used to define the type of catalogue

A: Auction Catalogues

P: Private Catalogues

TransferConfig.description:
Used to identify document transfer type: Restrict, Unrestrict, and Exclude.

Only used for data retrieval. Do not include it in the response.

TransferType.description:
Unrestrict: Send document to all members
Restrict: Send document to appointed members
Exclude: Send to all members excluding the appointed members

isFinalCatalogue.description:
A boolean value to indicate whether the related section of the catalogue transmission is expected to have more amendments transmitted or is the final transmission for that section.

true: is a final catalogue.

false: is not a final catalogue.

storageDescription.description: Used to provide more details on location within the Storage Organisations facility - such as street address, warehouse number etc.  to assist delivery.

discountRate.description: Total 4 digits with 2 digits after the decimal point. e.g. 23.76

penaltyInterestRate.description: Total 4 digits with 2 digits after the decimal point. e.g. 23.76

isReservePriceDisplayed.description:
A boolean value to indicate whether to display reserve price to buyers.

true: display.

false: not display.

SaleIdentity.description:
A group field of SellingCentre/Type and Sale Number
            
From: The current value that the Sale Identity is to be changed from.
            
To: The new value that the Sale Identity is to be changed to.

WoolState.description:
The state of the wool itemised in the invoice.
1. Greasy
2. Dead
3. Slipe
4. Scoured
5. Carbonised
6. Wool tops
7. Wool noils
8. Carded sliver
9. Other processed wool
A. Alpaca
C. Cashmere
M. Mohair

PackType.description:
A code used to indicate how the wool has been baled. The most common type is Farm bales. Original - the pack type when the wool was originally baled. Preferred - The pack type which the buyer would prefer to be used when his wool is dumped.
0: Standard (farm) bale
1: Bag/butt
2: Lightweight bale
3: Jumbo bale
4: Single bales (normal density dumped)
5: Single bales (high density dumped)
6: Single bales (super high density dumped)
7: 3 bale tripack (super high density dumped)
8: 2 bale tripack (super high density dumped)
9: U bales
A: 4 or 6 bale unitised (normal density dumped)
B: 4 or 6 bale unitised (high density dumped)
C: 4 or 6 bale unitised (super high density dumped)
D: Two Bale Module (2BM)
E: J9 size bale used for scoured wool
F: J12 size bale used for scoured wool
Z: Mixed (to be used with groups only, that is, record type 12)

value.description: Total up to 12 digits with 2 digits after the decimal point.

CurrencyCode.description:
AUD: Australian Dollars
BEF: Belgian Francs
NZD: New Zealand Dollars
BGP: British Pounds
FRF: French Francs
DEM: German Deutsche Marks
ITL: Italy Lire
CNY: Chinese Yuan
ANG: Netherlands Antilles Guilders
BEF: Taiwan New Dollars
ZAR: South Africa Rand
USD: USA Dollars
EUR: Euro

CalculationBasis.description:
This is used to identify the method used to calculate the post sale charge. The post sale charge may be a per bale, per kilogram or percentage of the price of the wool. Calculation Basis is always per bale in Australia.
B: Post sale charge is levied per bale
K: The post sale charge is a charge per kil
P: The post sale charge is a % of first cost

CatalogueSection.description:
These are the codes allocated by the local wool authorities to sectionalise the sale catalogues.
BLK: ODDS - Black
DEAD: ODDS - Dead
FLC: MFLC - Merino Fleece
FMG: ODDS - Fellmongered
ODD: ODDS - Oddments
SKIN: ODDS - Skin Wool
SKT: MSKT - Skirting
TRAD: MFLC / MSKT / XBFS / ODDS - Traditionally Shown
XBD: C XBFS - Crossbred (Flc & Skt)

WoolTypeGroup.description:
A code to indicate which section of the sale that lot belongs.
MFLC: Merino fleece types
MSKT: Merino fleece types
XBFS: Merino fleece types
ODDS: Merino fleece types

DeliveryBasis.description:
D: Delivery Nominated Destination
L: Loaded on Transport

UtcDateTime.description: Date and Time value in ISO 8601 standard UTC datetime format. e.g. 2024-03-21T19:25:04+00:00.000Z

SaleType.description:
A: Auction (open cry)
T: Tender
O: Offer
AV: Availability
E: Electronic Sale

baleIdentifications.description: This field is completely optional when sending Auction Catalogue Updates

interlotComponentBales.description: This field is completely optional when sending Auction Catalogue Updates

cataloguePageNumber.description: The page of the printed auction catalogue on which the lot details will appear

isNoLot.description:
A boolean value to indicate whether the lot is included for sale in the auction.

It is used in New Zealand only.

true: normal Lot.

false: not a normal Lot.

catalogueSymbol.description:
These are the symbols defined in the AWEX Wool Selling Rules, to be 
printed in a sale catalogue against any appropriate lot.In a transmitted
catalogue they are left justified with no space or punctuation marks
between symbols where more than one symbol is used.If this field
contains spaces it will indicate that there are no catalogue symbols for 
that lot.

To obtain the current code list of values that may be used in this field
please go to this URL: http://www.awex.com.au/standards/catalogue/.

clientCrossReference.description:
The identity given to the lot in the computer system by the owner of the wool.

Clients Cross Reference is transmitted by the owner of the wool to a Test House when the owner either verifies a test request(in a type of
TRV document) or requests the printing of a certificate(in a type TCR document). If it is included in the transmission to the Test House, the
Test House will also include it in its transmission of the certificate.The owner of the wool will then be able to connect the transmitted certificate
with the wool in its computer system.In a Test Request Verification document, the field must contain the weight note number of the lot.
The value in this field is NOT printed on the certificate.It is the value in the Certificate Reference field that is printed on the certificate.

woolDescriptionComment.description: This field provides for additional comments relating to the information contained in the Wool Description field.

woolDescription.description:
This field contains a description that is either an AWEX-ID description or another appraisal description.

Alternative valid appraisal descriptions include AWC type, Exporter type.

The AWEX-ID description must conform to the current AWEX-ID code standard.

If sending an AWC type, the first character of this field must be set to `W`, followed by the AWC Type, for all other non AWEX-ID typing descriptions the first character should be set to `P` followed by the type.If sending AWEX-ID the type starts from position one of the field (i.e.there are no leading characters). 

This field is to be always transmitted in upper case.

isGstApplicable.description:
A boolean value to indicate whether the GST amount is applicable to invoice. 

true: applicable.

false: not applicable.

woolDescriptionAuditCode.description: Audit code used for verifying if AWEX-ID was issued by AWEX.

numberOfOverweightBales.description: This is the total number of bales with a Reweigh Gross Kg over 204kg.

LotIdentity.description:
This is a compound name for lot number and lot suffix, where the lot 
number is 5 numeric characters and the lot suffix is 1 alphanumeric
character.The suffix is used when a lot is broken up by the original lot
number is retained; for example.If 2 bales of a 10-bale lot got wet and
the 8 bales and the 2 bales are offered separately, one could have a
suffix A and the other a suffix B.Where a suffix is not used, the lot
number occupies the whole of the Lot Identity field and is right justified.
            
From:
            
The current value that the Lot Identity is to be changed from.

To:

The new value that the Lot Identity is to be changed to.

Weight.description:
coreSampleWeight: The weight of the initial core sample.

sampleWeightRemoved: The weight of wool removed after testing, to adjust the issued test results, in compliance with the relevant standard (e.g. removal of wet 
wool, contract weight adjustment, retained buyer sample, etc.).

declaredGross: The gross weight of the lot as declared by the owner.

declaredTare: The tare weight of the lot as declared by the owner.

regrabSampleWeight: The weight of a regrab sample, a grab sample taken after the wool has been initially sampled and tested, is shown on the new certificate.

massOfGlobalSample: Unit in Grams.

sumOfOdMasses: Unit in Grams.

gainLossOfInvoiceMass: Refer to Invoice Mass Flag to determine Gain or Loss.

netWeightOdOfConsignment: Unit in KG.

officialRegain: Unit in KG.

conditioningMass: Mass of the sample after conditioning to a specified regain. Min: The lowest value in a range of Conditioning Mass values. Max: The highest value in a range of Conditioning Mass values.

gross: Total weight of the wool. In transmissions from Test Houses, Gross includes Regrab Sample Weight. In all other transmissions, Regrab 
Sample Weight will have been subtracted from the Gross of a lot or a group before the transmission. See the chapter Business Rules for a fuller explanation.

tare: The weight of the bale packaging.

lightestIndividualBaleWeight: This is the Reweigh Gross Kg of the lightest bale in the lot.

cleanWeight: Clean weight = Net Weight X Yield

SourceCode.description:
Source of the lot presented for sale.
1: Grower
2: Dealer
3: BulkClass

UpdateType.description:
A flag to indicate what type of change has been made to an item.
A: The entry is to be added
C: The entry is to be changed
D: The entry is to be deleted

PackMaterial.description:
Where a line/lot contains a Pack with a lower Material, the lower Material shall apply.The hierarchy from highest to lowest is N, E, J, K. Printed catalogue condition: The code for Nylon packs shall not be printed (but shall be transmitted).
N: Nylon Packs (complete lots only)
E: Experimental Packs
J: Jute packs (complete lots or lots that contain portions of Nylon and/or HDPE 5 and/or HDPE 1 and Jute packs)
K: HDPE1 packs (complete lots or lots that contain portions of Nylon and/or HDPE 5 and HDPE 1 packs)

LotType.description:
A code used to describe wool lot preparation. It is not wool type. `*` wool meets clip preparation guidelines.`#` wool does not necessarily meet clip preparation guidelines
1: (Suffix - P) Classed Grower Lot *
2: (Suffix - M) Objectively Matched Lot
3: (Suffix - J) Combined Certificate
4: (Suffix - I) Subjectively Matched Interlot
5: (Suffix - B) Other Bulk Class Lot #
6: Not Used
7: (Suffix - N) Objectively Matched Interlot
8: (Suffix - Q) Classed Bulk Class Lot Quality Managed *
9: (Suffix - D) Other Grower Lot #

ReportingFlag.description:
R: Report, results for this test are supplied for information only
C: Certificate results for this test are certified
U: This lot is untested and there are no certificate results

YieldType.description:
Yield Type indicates either the type of yield transmitted in another field or record, or the type of yield used to arrive at the value in another field.
1. RESERVED
2. RESERVED
3. Estimated.
4. Schlumberger Combed Dry (1% TFM)
5. Schlumberger Combed Dry (2% TFM)
7. Noble Combed in Oil
8. IWTO Scoured Yield at 16% Regain
9. IWTO Scoured Yield at 17% Regain
10. Japanese Clean Scoured
11. Australian Carbonising
12. IWTO Clean Wool Content, 17% Regain
13. United States Custom Clean
14. Card Sliver
15. ASTM Clean Wool Fibre Present
16. Noble Dry Combed
17. Schlumberger Combed in Oil (4.6% TFM)
18. Noble Combed Dry
19. Theoretical Card Sliver
20. ASTM Laboratory Scoured Yield
21. Conditioned at 12.00%
22. Conditioned at 13.00%
23. Conditioned at 13.50%
24: Conditioned at 13.64%
25. Conditioned at 14.00%
26. Conditioned at 14.40%
27. Conditioned at 15.00%
28. Conditioned at 16.00%
29. Conditioned at 17.00%
30. Conditioned at 18.00%
31. Conditioned at 18.25%
32. Japanese Clean Scoured at 17%
33. New Zealand Process Yield
42. IWT0 Schlumberger Oil T&N (2.0% & T.FM.)
43. IWTO Clean Wool Content, 16% Regain

OfferType.description:
P: Previous/Passed-In Price
N: Negotiable Price
R: Reserve Price

PackCondition.description:
Where a line/lot contains a Pack with a lower condition, the lower condition shall apply. The hierarchy from highest to lowest is N, M, R, X. This field is optional in New Zealand transmissions.
N: New Pack (not previously used)
M: Marked (not previously cored and grabbed
R: Repaired (previously core and/or grabbed and repaired)
X: Not repaired (previously cored and/or grabbed) (excl reoffer

PriceBasis.description:
G: Greasy
C: CLCOF (ACOF or NZCOF)
I: CIF
F: FOB

encryptedLotHeaderAwexDataString.description:
The encrypted LotHeaderAwexData in string format based on base64 encoding and JWE (JSON Web Encryption) for encryption: https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7516.

The schema reference can be found here: #/components/schemas/LotHeaderAwexData.

Detailed schema in yaml format:

LotHeaderAwexData:

  type: object
  
  properties:
  
    awexId:
    
      maxLength: 20
      
      minLength: 1
      
      type: string
      
      description: AWEX-ID must conform to the current AWEX-ID code standard.
      
      nullable: true
      
    appraiserId:
    
      maxLength: 6
      
      minLength: 1
      
      type: string
      
      description: Contains the AWEX accredited appraiser ID for this lot.
      
      nullable: true
      
    classersRegisteredNumber:
    
      maxLength: 6
      
      minLength: 1
      
      type: string
      
      description: The AWEX stencil number of the classer or classing house responsible for the final classification of the wool before sale.
      
      nullable: true
      
    awexIdComment:
    
      maxLength: 14
      
      minLength: 1
      
      type: string
      
      description: This field provides for additional comments relating to the information contained in the `awexId` field.
      
      nullable: true
      
    awexIdAuditCode:
    
      maxLength: 10
      
      minLength: 1
      
      type: string
      
      description: Audit code used for verifying if `awexId` was issued by AWEX
      
      nullable: true

qualitySchemeRegistrationId.description: Registered Identification issued by the relevant Accreditation or Membership organisation.

qualitySchemeOtherDetail.description: Used to transmit (other) information relevant to the Scheme that is required by the buyer(e.g.Month/Year shorn).

QualityScheme.description:
The registered four character or less quality scheme code: To obtain the current code list please go to this URL: http://www.awex.com.au/standards/catalogue/
ASWG: Australian Superfine Woolgrower Association (Member)
AUTH: Authentico
BETC: Better Choices (Pain Mitigation)
BIOC: BioClip (Biologically Harvested)
DAL3: Dalcare-3
EUEC: EU Eco label (meets EU Eco standards)
MTEC: Merino Tech WA
ACO: Organic - Australian Certified Organic
DBAA: Organic - Demeter Biodynamic Agriculture Aust.
USA: Organic - Meets USA Certification requirements
NASA: Organic - National Association for Sustainable Agriculture Aust.
SXC: Organic - Southern Cross Certified
RWS: Responsible Wool Standard
SBFC: Schute Bell Fibre Care
SW: SustainaWOOL
SWAU: SustainaWOOL Gold
TQMS: Traprock QMS/TIMS
FAP: Farm Assurance Program
PWIA: PGG Wrightson Integrity Assured
FERN: Woolcare Fernmark

MulesingStatus.description:
NM: Non Mulesed
LN: Liquid Nitrogen
CM: Ceased Mulesing
AA: Mulesed with Analgesic &/or Anaesthetic
M: Mulesed
ND: Not Declared

woolBase.description:
The oven-dry mass of wool fibre free from all impurities, expressed as a percentage of the mass of the sample.

Min The lowest value in a range of Wool Base values

Max The highest value in a range of Wool Base values

vmb.description:
Vegetable Matter Base. The oven dry mass of ash-free, ethyl alcohol 
extractives - free burrs(including hardheads), twigs, seeds, leaves
and grasses present, expressed as a percentage of the mass of the
greasy core sample.

Average.

The average value of vegetable matter base values for a number of lots.

Minimum.

The lowest value in a range of vegetable matter base values.

Maximum.

The highest value in a range of vegetable matter base values.

vm1.description: The % of the core sample composed of burrs

vm2.description: The % of the core sample composed of seeds and shive

vm3.description: The % of the core sample composed of hardheads

factorAirflowMean.description: Factor for Airflow Mean. Factor used in combination calculation.

TestDetailType.description:
C: Combination Detail
P: Core Test Detail
F: Premium Test Detail
I: Subjective Interlot Detail
M: OML Detail
N: OMI Detail
R: Guidance Report Detail
W: Scoured Test Detail
Y: Post-Sale Core Test Detail

CertificateIdentity.description:
The certificate identity consists of a 1 digit prefix, followed by an 8 digit certificate number, followed by a 1 character suffix, followed by a 1 digit
check number.It is printed at the top of the certificate.

CertificateIdPrefix.description:
2: Sydney Laboratory
3: Melbourne Laboratory
6: Fremantle Laboratory

CertificateIdSuffix.description:
B: Bulk Class
C: Colour
D: PTC (Pre-Sale Test Certificate Other Grower Lot)
F: Premium Test
I: Subjectively Appraised Interlot
J: Combination - Yield & Micron, Length & Strength, Colour
L: Length & Strength
M: Objectively Matched Lot
N: Objectively matched Interlot
Q: Bulk Class Quality Managed
P: PTC (Pre-sale Test Certificate - Classed Grower Lot)
R: Guidance Report
W: Scoured Wool
Y: Post sale Core Test

Laboratory.description:
The code for a Test House.
1: Australian Wool Testing Authority
2: N.Z. Wool Testing Authority
3: N.Z. Wool Testing Service
4: South African Wool Testing Authority

yieldValue.description: The amount of recoverable fibre from a lot under set processing conditions

ReissueChargeFlag.description:
0: Original certificate charge
1: Re-issued no charge
2: Re-issued with additional Charge
3: Re-issued with replacement charge (credit issued against original certificate)

DarkAndMedullatedFibreRisk.description:
The following codes are applicable to lots sampled on or after 1st July, 2004. Spaces will be returned for lots sampled before this date where data is not provided.
E: Error in Processing
N: Not Applicable
D: Not Declared
1: Risk Level 1 (lowest)
2: Risk Level 2
3: Risk Level 3
4: Risk Level 4
5: Risk Level 5
6: Risk Level 6

CombinationFlag.description:
This field indicates the following: If an Australian Securities Exchange combination was requested and the combination satisfies the contract parameters of ASX the appropriate flag will be transmitted.
N. Normal Combination
S. ASX24 Combination (formerly SFE)
4. ASX19.5 54W Combination
5. ASX21.0 55W Combination
6. ASX22.6 56W Combination
7. ASX19.5 54W, ASX21.0 55W and ASX22.6 56W Combination
8. ASX19.5 54W and ASX21.0 55W Combination
9: ASX21.0 55W and ASX22.6 56W Combination
A. ICAP Wool Contract - China Type 54P
B. ICAP Wool Contract - China Type 54
C. ICAP Wool Contract - China Type 55
D. ICAP Wool Contract - China Type 56
E. ICAP Wool Contract - China Type 424
F. ICAP Wool Contract - China Type Standard

colourZ.description:
Colour Z value.

This measurement is used in New Zealand, but not in Australia.

colourYZ.description: Average yellowness, Colour Y  Colour Z. The field has an optional leading sign.

colourXMinimum.description: Min  The lowest value in a range of Colour-X values.

colourXMaximum.description: Max  The highest value in a range of Colour-X values.

colourYMinimum.description: Min  The lowest value in a range of Colour-Y values.

colourYMaximum.description: Max  The highest value in a range of Colour-Y values.

colourZMinimum.description: Min  The lowest value in a range of Colour-Z values.

colourZMaximum.description: Max  The highest value in a range of Colour-Z values.

colourYZMinimum.description: Min  The lowest value in a range of Colour-Y-Z values.

colourYZMaximum.description: Max  The highest value in a range of Colour-Y-Z values.

colourXAsIs.description: Colour X value for scoured wool.

colourYAsIs.description: Colour Y value for scoured wool.

colourZAsIs.description: Colour Z value for scoured wool.

colourYZAsIs.description: Colour Y  Colour Z, that is average yellowness for scoured wool.The field has an optional leading sign.

ColourTestDetailType.description:
C: Colour Test Detail
X: Colour Combination Test Detail

CalibrationFlag.description:
O: The values for Colour X, Y, Z and Y-Z have been measured by an instrument calibrated to reference wool, based on illuminant C and 2 observer angle. Old calibration has been deactivated as at 1st January 2001.
N: The values for Colour X, Y, Z and Y-Z have been measured by an instrument calibrated to certified tiles, based on illuminant D65 and 10 observer angle, and corrected for any glass effects

stapleLength.description: The mean length of a staple from tip to base. At least 60 staples are measured for each test lot.

stapleLengthMinimum.description:
The mean length of a staple from tip to base. At least 60 staples are measured for each test lot. 
            
Minimum - the lowest value in a range of staple length values.

stapleLengthMaximum.description:
The mean length of a staple from tip to base. At least 60 staples are measured for each test lot. 
            
Maximum - the highest value in a range of staple length values.

stapleStrengthMinimum.description:
The force required to break a staple of given thickness. 
            
The average strength is expressed in Newtons per kilotex.Individual staples range in strength from 0 to 100 Newtons per kilotex
            
Minimum - The lowest value in a range of staple strength values

stapleStrengthMaximum.description:
The force required to break a staple of given thickness. 
            
The average strength is expressed in Newtons per kilotex.Individual staples range in strength from 0 to 100 Newtons per kilotex
            
Maximum - The highest value in a range of staple strength value

stapleLengthCvPercentage.description: Staple length coefficient of variation. This is a measurement of the staple length variability and is reported as a percentage.

stapleStrength.description:
The force required to break a staple of given thickness. 
            
The average strength is expressed in Newtons per kilotex.Individual staples range in strength from 0 to 100 Newtons per kilotex

positionOfBreakPercentageTip.description:
The position of break indicates the location of the weakest part of the staple.
            
Tip - Percentage of wool staple with a tip section position of break.

positionOfBreakPercentageMiddle.description:
The position of break indicates the location of the weakest part of the staple. 
            
Middle - Percentage of wool staples with a middle section position of break.

positionOfBreakPercentageBase.description:
The position of break indicates the location of the weakest part of the staple.

Base - Percentage of wool staples with a base section position of break.

team3Hauteur.description:
Predicted Fibre Length in the Top. NOTE: Any certificate issued (or reissued with a new Certificate ID Number) from 1st July, 2006 will be based on the TEAM-3 calculations. 
            
Anything issued prior to 1st July, 2006 will be based on the TEAM-2 calculations.
            
A check against the Date Issued field in the Length and Strength Details record will determine which TEAM formula has been used.

isLsSampleSecured.description:
A boolean value to indicate whether the LS-sample is secured.
            
true: secured
            
false: not secured

expectedBarbe.description:
Expected Barbe length in the Top. Used for NZ Crossbred wool certificates based on the 2016 calculation. 
            
Any Length and Strength certificate for NZ Crossbred wool will include a calculated Barbe value based on the 2016 calculation.

team3HauteurCvPercentage.description: Coefficient of Variation of Hauteur. NOTE: Refer to note in Team3Hauteur.

team3RomainePercentage.description: Romaine. NOTE: Refer to note in Team3Hauteur.

stapleStrengthLowest25Percent.description: Average Staple Strength of the lowest 25% of staples measured for Strength.

LengthAndStrengthTestDetailType.description:
L: Length And Strength Test Detail
K: Length And Strength Combination Test Detail

LsCertType.description:
0: Length & Strength tested
1: Length only test requested
2: Insufficient staples

comfortFactorPercentage.description: Percentage of Fibres 30 Microns and under.

mean.description: This is Laserscan Mean or OFDA Mean depending on the value of instrument

meanMinimum.description: This is the Laserscan or OFDA Mean Minimum depending on the value of instrument.This field will contain spaces until 30/06/2000

meanMaximum.description: This is the Laserscan or OFDA Mean Maximum depending on the value of instrument.This field will contain spaces until 30/06/2000

factorLaserscanNumerator.description: Factor used in numerator to calculate Laserscan Mean Laserscan Mean = Factor Laserscan Numerator/Factor Laserscan Denominator

factorLaserscanDenominator.description: Factor used in denominator to calculate Laserscan Mean Laserscan Mean = Factor Laserscan Numerator/Factor Laserscan Denominator

fibresMeasuredPercentage.description: Percentage of fibres measured for the measurement.

brand.description: This field is to be always transmitted in upper case.

areaOfOrigin.description:
The code for the area in which the wool was grown.

For further information please go to this URL:

http://www.awex.com.au/market-information/wool-statistical-areas-wsa/

BaleDescription.description: This field is to be always transmitted in upper case.

baleNumber.description: The number used to identify a bale in a lot

brand.description: This field is to be always transmitted in upper case.

areaOfOrigin.description:
The code for the area in which the wool was grown.

For further information please go to this URL:

http://www.awex.com.au/market-information/wool-statistical-areas-wsa/

apiMessages.description: Contains information about the response if applicable.

ApiResult.description: A standard API response object used for all successful API responses

WarningCode.description:
A code to indicate the different types of errors.
11: Weight Note suffix is not numeric or has been omitted.
12: Number of bales is invalid or has been omitted.
13: Sale identification has been omitted.
18: Invalid Gross weight.
19: Invalid Tare weight.
20: Invalid Centre/Client code on pre-sale test request.
24: Incorrect PCTR Hash total.
DRVnn: Dark and Medullated Fibre Risk error where nn is the field number in error.

InformationCode.description:
A code to indicate the information.

For AC, PC LI and GI transmissions, one record will be sent for each Wool Sale Header Lots received.

OK - aaaaaDATA RECEIVED OK FOR aann/nn dd/mm/yy ooooo LOTS nnnn

Where aann/nn = sale number/season
    
dd/mm/yy = sale date
    
ooooo = selling organisation
    
nnnnn = number of lots
    
Reason - You have sent data to the network and it has been received with no communication or transmission errors.

Action - None.

OR

For all other types of transmissions, one record will be sent for each transmission file received.

OK - ALL aaaaa DATA RECEIVED OK

Reason - You have sent data to the network and it has been received with no communication or transmission errors.

Action - None.

type.description:
A URI reference [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type.

This specification encourages that, when dereferenced, it provide human-readable documentation for the problem type (e.g., using HTML [W3C.REC-html5-20141028]). 
            
When this member is not present, its value is assumed to be "about:blank".

e.g. For 400 Bad Request, the "type" value can be "https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc9110#section-15.5.1"

title.description:
A short, human-readable summary of the problem type.

It SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization(e.g., using proactive content negotiation; see[RFC7231], Section 3.4).

e.g. "One or more validation errors occurred."

status.description: The HTTP status code ([RFC7231], Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. e.g. 400, 403, or business relared problem etc.

ApiErrorResult.description: A machine-readable format for specifying errors in HTTP API responses based on https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7807.

errors.description: Dictionary of errors in <PropertyName, ErrorDetails[]> format. e.g. errors: { "name": ["Product name is required"], "category": ["Category name cannot be longer than 20 characters."]  }

errorCode.description:
The error code is defined by business rules to indicate the different types of errors.

Examples of error code:
 
DOXCT: Document originator does not match current transmitter."
            
INVTC: Invalid transfer config. All data rejected."

INVFR: Invalid/missing FinalReceiverList record. All data rejected."
            
INVAC: Invalid sale aann/nn dd/mm/yy ooooo. All data rejected."

INVCR: Current receiver not awtm. All data rejected."

INVDO: Invalid document originator code aaaaa. Data accepted."

INVSO: Warning! Invalid selling org AAAAA using doc orig AAAAA."

INVEX: Invalid excluded record."

itemsToBeExcluded.description:
Catalogue item names to be excluded in the request.

Only required for request for Catalogue. Not applicable for other documents.

CatalogueTransmissionType.description:
Used to define the types of Catalogue. Only required for requesting Catalogue. Not Applicable for other documents.
2: Auction Catalogues
3: Private Catalogues
5: Auction Catalogue Updates

isUsingNetworkDateTime.description:
A boolean value to indicate whether to use network datetime.

true: use network datetime.

false: not use.

apiMessages.description: Contains information about the response if applicable.

CatalogueListApiResult.description: A standard API response object used for all successful API responses

Bearer.description: JWT Access Token that is added in the Authorization header of the HTTP request. Example: "Authorization: Bearer {token}". The JWT serves as a credential that proves the identity of the client to the server.
Bearer.name: Authorization

oauth2.description: Authentication for client applications by providing Client ID and Client Secret for an JWT Access Token.
